image.altText: People sunbaking at Clovelly Beach

props.synopsis: The current heatwave is set to break temperature records in parts of NSW from today, with the far west expected to bear the brunt of the heat.

title.children: NSW to experience hottest weather in years as heatwave peaks

image.altText: Park grass cordoned off with tape and signs

props.synopsis: Contaminated mulch containing asbestos has been found in Sydney's inner west and western suburbs after first being discovered in Rozelle Parklands. How worried should people be about this substance?

title.children: How dangerous is the asbestos found in mulch around Sydney? Here's what we know

image.altText: Rozeleen Kumar standing in a flood-damaged room in her home.

props.synopsis: After two years of floods inundating the east coast of Australia, thousands of customers are still waiting for their claims to be finalised.

title.children: 'I would prefer to deal with Satan': Thousands of 2022 flood victims still waiting on building insurance claims

image.altText: Man wearing a blue business shirt, orange hi-vis and hard hat standing on a roof.

props.synopsis: As Australia grapples with housing affordability, NSW is at the forefront of another crisis sweeping new builds. Problems within the industry have led to an explosion of work for building commissioner David Chandler since his 2019 appointment.

title.children: More than half of newly registered NSW apartments have had a serious defect

image.altText: Two men and a woman in suits stand behind podiums in front of a doorway into Parliament House.

props.synopsis: The government will halve the stage 3 tax cuts for the highest earners and use the money to deliver an $804 tax cut across the board.

title.children: Most taxpayers to get $804, but high-end tax cut halved as government rewrites stage 3

image.altText: a kelpie in a water tank with its paws over the edge as cows in the background looking on

props.synopsis: Dairy cows are one of the animals most susceptible to heat stress, which can result in reduced milk production and fertility. As temperatures soar, farmers look to keep their cows cool.

title.children: Cold water, shade sails and sprinklers keeping cows cool as heatwave builds

image.altText: A helicopter ambulance on the beach with a number of emergency personnel.

props.synopsis: Police say three people have died after getting into difficulty in the water at a beach south-east of Melbourne.

title.children: Three people dead, one critical after being pulled from water at Phillip Island beach, police say

image.altText: A screen shot of the leaked document sits beside an image of Debbie Ngarewa-Packer a co-leader of the Maori Party

props.synopsis: As a minor party in New Zealand's governing coalition pushes ahead with a plan to draft a controversial bill on the country's founding documents, Māori leaders have issued a warning.

title.children: A leaked memo, legal battles and a call-to-action from the Māori king — NZ is on edge

image.altText: Mark McCudden sitting in his office in front of pictures of his family.

props.synopsis: The only pharmaceutical company in Australia which supplies the critical ADHD drug Vyvanse is in the grips of a global shortage, plunging some Australians into fear and uncertainty.

title.children: Australians with ADHD endure months-long shortage of critical treatment drug

image.altText: Three men in blue and black cricket uniforms hug and smile.

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Heat have beaten the Sydney Sixers by 54 runs in the Big Bash League final at the SCG to claim their first men's title in 11 years.

title.children: Heat beat Sixers by 54 runs to win second Big Bash League title

image.altText: An indoor basketball room filled with people, bedding, chairs and belongings.

props.synopsis: NSW government to review recommendations to ensure safety of  vulnerable women and children

title.children: Disturbing research uncovers claims 'bad things' happened to women in emergency centres

image.altText: A sign in a pharmacy that says "Speak to us today about vaccinations".

props.synopsis: Hany Barsoum says he feared for the safety of his staff during the exchange, which he believes "could have been really bad". Meanwhile, police have made courtroom arrest of a man associated with those involved in the incident over an unrelated matter.

title.children: Pharmacist rattled after anti-vaxxers accuse him of being 'complicit in murder'

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair, wearing a wide-brimmed hat, sitting at an outdoor table with a drink.

props.synopsis: Police allege the accused was driving in a dangerous and negligent manner when the crash occurred near Shellharbour. Alice Roy, 23, who died in the incident, was working and travelling in Australia.

title.children: Truck driver granted bail after crash involving scooter leaves young French woman dead

image.altText: Alex Zverev shouts with glee after winning the Australian quarterfinal against Carlos Alcaraz.

props.synopsis: Alex Zverev beats a top-five player at a major for the first time, taking down Carlos Alcaraz in four tense sets in their quarterfinal on Rod Laver Arena.

title.children: Alexander Zverev scores stunning win over Carlos Alcaraz to reach Australian Open semifinal

image.altText: West Indies celebrate a run out in black and white

props.synopsis: The early indications are that he Gabba Test of 2024 will not be a classic, but in 1960, on the occasion of the West Indies's second ever visit to the Queensland capital, the two sides played out one of just two ever Test ties.

title.children: 'The crowd was in a frenzy': Remembering Test cricket's first tie

image.altText: Russian plane

props.synopsis: A Russian military transport plane carrying 65 Ukrainian prisoners of war, six crew and three people accompanying them has crashed in Russia's Belgorod region near Ukraine, according to Russia's Defence Ministry.

title.children: Russian transport plane crashes near Ukraine with 65 Ukrainian POWs on board, Russian defence ministry says

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A man pointing

props.synopsis: Donald Trump won the New Hampshire primary just moments after polls closed. But a defiant speech from his rival left the former US president visibly frustrated.

title.children: 'Who the hell was the impostor?': Trump won, Haley lost, but his New Hampshire victory left him angry

image.altText: Andrew O'Keefe addresses the media wearing a suit and red glasses

props.synopsis: The 52-year-old is convicted by a Sydney magistrate of common assault, common assault occasioning actual bodily harm, breaching an AVO and drug possession.

title.children: 'Your actions are absolutely condemned': Former TV host Andrew O'Keefe sentenced for assaulting woman

image.altText: A floating ferry allows cars to drive on board

props.synopsis: Commuters are facing journeys extended by up to 50 minutes in some parts of the city.

title.children: Peak hour strikes to stop Sydney's wire-drawn ferries as industrial dispute escalates

image.altText: A grown man crashes into a child in a soccer pitch

props.synopsis: From tackling a child during soccer training in Tasmania to pausing the re-opening of the international border when COVID-19 was running rampant around the world, here are some of Scott Morrison's most memorable moments.

title.children: From tackling a child to closing the borders, here are Scott Morrison's political feats and faux pas

image.altText: Smoke rises from a burning building amid a deadly fire, in Johannesburg, South Africa

props.synopsis: A deadly building fire in Johannesburg that killed 76 last year was started by a man trying to dispose of the body of someone he had strangled on the orders of a drug dealer.

title.children: Surprise strangling confession explains origin of deadly Johannesburg fire

image.altText: Kim Williams at a press conference in Canberra

props.synopsis: How does a clarinettist who was a national Lego champion as a boy, a conscientious objector to the Vietnam War, whose first wife was a famous author and comedian and second, the daughter of an Australian prime minister, end up widely known as a media executive?

title.children: Kim Williams was rejected when he applied to run the ABC, aged 29. Now he finally gets his chance

image.altText: The court surface at the Australian Open is inspected.

props.synopsis: Matt Ebden says he was left "a little bit" frustrated and surprised after his Australian Open doubles match was halted due to issues with the court surface at Melbourne Park.

title.children: 'I've never seen it': Australian Open doubles match moved after 'bubbles' appear on court

image.altText: Steve Smith prepares to run onto the field next to an Australian flag

props.synopsis: Steve Smith has echoed Pat Cummins and called for a change to the date of Australia Day as Cricket Australia continues to face scrutiny from some sectors regarding their stance on the day.

title.children: Steve Smith joins Pat Cummins in calling for a change to the date of Australia Day

image.altText: Jim Chalmers in the foreground in focus, with Anthony Albanese in the background out of focus, from the right hand side

props.synopsis: The government, in an election promise backflip, will overhaul stage 3 tax cuts, leaving most Australians with extra cash in their pocket when the measures take effect in July.

title.children: 'Better for nurses, teachers and truckies': Government to overhaul stage 3 tax cuts, broadening benefits

image.altText: man exits building surrounded by other people

props.synopsis: Christopher Ralls was driving a ute along a Gippsland road when he fatally struck 55-year-old Russell Evans, who had stepped out of his car to help his son change a flat tyre.

title.children: Driver avoids prison over crash that killed family friend changing tyre on side of highway

image.altText: A young man with a moustache sits in a car and takes a selfie. His face is cut and bruised.

props.synopsis: Two NSW police officers have been charged with assault after a brawl with NRL star Tom Starling on the state's Central Coast more than three years ago.

title.children: Police officers charged over 'free for all' brawl that left NRL player bloodied and bruised

image.altText: Dayana Yastremska celebrates winning her Australian Open quarterfinal.

props.synopsis: After advancing to the semifinals as a qualifier, Dayana Yastremska pays tribute to her mother, who has accompanied her daughter on her inspiring run at Melbourne Park.

title.children: Ukrainian qualifier on a 'mission' to do her family and besieged country proud

image.altText: Man dressed in all black holding a gun at shooting of Mahmoud Abbas in Greenacre street

props.synopsis: Mahmoud Abbas was shot outside of his Greenacre home last July, and the identity of the gunman remains unknown.

title.children: Dramatic footage released of moment criminal defence lawyer was shot in his Sydney driveway

image.altText: Composite image of Lily Gladstone, Margot Robbie and Greta Gerwig.

props.synopsis: The internet is fuming that Margot Robbie and Greta Gerwig were passed over for best actress and best director nominations for the 2024 Academy Awards. So how did we get here?

title.children: Eight Oscar nominations for Barbie isn't a snub — here's why

image.altText: CoolSeal installation in the City of Charles Sturt

props.synopsis: Los Angeles and other US cities have embraced lighter-coloured "cool roads" in response to climate change and heatwaves. So why isn't Australia doing the same?

title.children: Why hot Australian cities keep laying dark heat-absorbing asphalt, not pale 'cool roads'
